articles.title: Wirtschaft
articles.image_title: Supermarket staples increased by 8%. File photo dated 05/11/13 of assorted pasta. Supermarket staples like pasta, tinned tomatoes and strawberry jam increased in price by around 8% in just one year. According to new figures, the overall price of a basket of 15 standard food items rose by £1.32. Issue date: Saturday February 12, 2022. The data analysed by the BBC came from the retail research firm Assosia, which tracked the average cost of grocery items at Asda, Morrisons, Sainsbury's and Tesco. The company recorded more than 17,000 price increases across the main supermarkets in January, more than double the number in the same month last year, and across every category. See PA story CONSUMER Food . Photo credit should read: Rui Vieira/PA Wire URN:65249433
articles.author: Carsten Dierig
